title: 150 Followers Question
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Suppose a function "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f : R → R"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" satisfi es the following conditions:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(a)  f(4xy) = 2y [f(x + y) + f(x -y)],"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x, y ∈ R"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(b)  f(5) = 3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(2015)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

title: 150 Followers Question
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 25^{12}; b = 16^{14},"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"c = 11^{16}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Which of the following is the largest?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If a = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"25^{12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", b = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16^{14}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and c = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11^{16}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", for to discover the largest, you must to find the logarithm of each number. Then a = log "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"25^{12}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", b = log "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16^{14}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and c = log "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"11^{16}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Thence, a = 16.77, b = 16.85 and c = 16.66."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So, a = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^{16.77}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", b = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^{16.85}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and c = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10^{16.66}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Therefore the largest number is b = "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"16^{14}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=25^{12}=5^{24},b=16^{14}=2^{56},c=11^{16}\\
\begin{aligned}
a-b&=5^{24}-2^{56}\\
&=(5^{12}-2^{28})(5^{12}+2^{28})\\
&=(5^6-2^{14})(5^6+2^{14})(5^{12}+2^{28})\\
&=(5^3-2^7)(5^3+2^7)(5^6+2^{14})(5^{12}+2^{28})\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Now notice that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^3-2^7=-3<0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":",so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a-b<0\implies b>a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".Similarly:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}
a-c&=5^{24}-11^{16}\\
&=(5^{12}-11^8)(5^{12}+11^8)\\
&=(5^6-11^4)(5^6+11^4)(5^{12}+11^8)\\
&=(5^3-11^2)(5^3+11^2)(5^6+11^4)(5^{12}+11^8)
\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
As "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^3-11^2=4>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a-c>0\implies a>c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".Therefore,"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b>a>c"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" hence "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{b}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is the largest."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 150 Followers Question
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many positive integers less than or equal to 2015 are divisible by 3, but are neither\ndivisible by 5 nor by 7?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Number divisible by 3 under 2015 are 671."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Numbers divisible by 5 in the list are also divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \cdot 5 = 15"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Numbers divisible by 15 under 2015 are 134."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Numbers divisible by 7 in the list are also divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \cdot 7 = 21"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Numbers divisible by 21 under 2015 are 95."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Total numbers divisible by 5 and 7 under 2015 are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"134+95 = 229"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Numbers divisible by 7 and 5 are repeated twice. So removing multiples of both 7 and 5 once will remove the repeats. Numbers divisible by 7 and 5 are also divisible by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \cdot 5 \cdot 7 = 105"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Number of multiples of 105 under 2015 are 19."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, numbers under 2015 which are multiple of 3, which are also multiple of 5 or 7 (or both) are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"229 - 19 = 210"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Numbers under 2015 which are divisible by 3 and are not multiples of 5 and 7 are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"671 - 210 = 461"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
